result.markdown:
--- title: Generalized Linear Models II



title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: /img/pika.png format: revealjs: chalkboard: true multiplex: true --- ## Objectives ```{=html} ``` - Poisson Regression - Numerical Optimization - categorical variables >2 levels - variable combinations ## Pika Study ![](/img/pika2.png) We sample plots of high elevation rocky outcrops, counting the number of pika within each plot; plot sizes are the same size. ## Poisson Regression We model the counts of American pika ($y_{i}$) at each site $i = 1...n$ as a Poisson random variable with parameter $\lambda$ being a function of our $p$ site-level variables in $n$ x $p$ design matrix ($\textbf{X}$) and coefficients $\boldsymbol{\beta}$ as, $$ \begin{align*} \textbf{y} \sim & \text{Poisson}(\boldsymbol{\lambda})\\ \text{log}(\boldsymbol{\lambda}) =& \textbf{X}\boldsymbol{\beta}\\ \boldsymbol{\lambda} =& e^{\textbf{X}\boldsymbol{\beta}}. \end{align*} $$ ## Data {.scrollable} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Counts by Site ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-2-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Fit Model {.scrollable} Interpret the Coefficients ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model = glm(y~site, data=dat, family = poisson(link = 'log') ) summary(model) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: glm(formula = y ~ site, family = poisson(link = "log"), data = dat) Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|) (Intercept) 1.02962 0.09449 10.896 < 2e-16 *** siteSite 2 -0.51381 0.15445 -3.327 0.000879 *** siteSite 3 0.57982 0.11802 4.913 8.97e-07 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 (Dispersion parameter for poisson family taken to be 1) Null deviance: 209.44 on 119 degrees of freedom Residual deviance: 137.65 on 117 degrees of freedom AIC: 467.21 Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 5 ``` ::: ::: ## Numerical Optimization of Likelihood ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model$converged ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] TRUE ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model$method ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "glm.fit" ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model$boundary ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] FALSE ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model$iter ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 5 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} model$control ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` $epsilon [1] 1e-08 $maxit [1] 25 $trace [1] FALSE ``` ::: ::: ## Side-Bar: Negative Log-Likelihood Function {.scrollable} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Here is our negative log-likelihood function with three #parameters - beta0, beta1, and beta2 (1) #inputs = design matrix X neg.log.like = function(par,X) { #linear model of parameters par and design matrix (X) lam=par[1]*X[,1]+par[2]*X[,2]+par[3]*X[,3] #neg log-likelihood sum(-dpois(y,lambda = exp(lam),log = TRUE)) } ``` ::: ## Numerical Optim. for MLEs ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #use optim with initial values and define the lower and upper limits of the possible values fit1 <- optim( par = c(0,0,0), #start X=X, fn = neg.log.like, method = "L-BFGS-B", lower = c(-10, -10, -10), upper = c(10, 10, 10) ) ``` ::: ::: {.fragment} ####

Comparison

::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) siteSite 2 siteSite 3 glm.fit 1.029620 -0.5138073 0.5798174 ours 1.029619 -0.5138063 0.5798185 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Controlling Dummy Coding {.scrollable} Make 'Site 2' the intercept ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} dat$site.re=relevel(dat$site,ref="Site 2") levels(dat$site.re) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] "Site 2" "Site 1" "Site 3" ``` ::: :::
::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model2 = glm(y~site.re, data=dat, family = poisson(link = 'log') ) summary(model2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` Call: glm(formula = y ~ site.re, family = poisson(link = "log"), data = dat) Coefficients: Estimate Std. Error z value Pr(>|z|) (Intercept) 0.5158 0.1222 4.222 2.42e-05 *** site.reSite 1 0.5138 0.1544 3.327 0.000879 *** site.reSite 3 1.0936 0.1412 7.748 9.37e-15 *** --- Signif. codes: 0 '***' 0.001 '**' 0.01 '*' 0.05 '.' 0.1 ' ' 1 (Dispersion parameter for poisson family taken to be 1) Null deviance: 209.44 on 119 degrees of freedom Residual deviance: 137.65 on 117 degrees of freedom AIC: 467.21 Number of Fisher Scoring iterations: 5 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Same Model Different Estimates {.scrollable} #### Coeficients ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) siteSite 2 siteSite 3 Model1 1.0296194 -0.5138063 0.5798185 Model2 0.5158132 0.5138063 1.0936247 ``` ::: ::: #### Predictions ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 1 2 3 4 5 Model1 1.029619 0.5158132 1.609438 1.029619 0.5158132 Model2 1.029619 0.5158132 1.609438 1.029619 0.5158132 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.fragment} #### Design Matrix ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) dat$siteSite 2 dat$siteSite 3 1 1 0 0 2 1 1 0 3 1 0 1 4 1 0 0 5 1 1 0 ``` ::: ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) dat$site.reSite 1 dat$site.reSite 3 1 1 1 0 2 1 0 0 3 1 0 1 4 1 1 0 5 1 0 0 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## More Control! [Deviation/Effect Coding Link](https://stats.stackexchange.com/questions/52132/how-to-do-regression-with-effect-coding-instead-of-dummy-coding-in-r) [Lots of options](https://stats.oarc.ucla.edu/r/library/r-library-contrast-coding-systems-for-categorical-variables/) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model3=glm(y~site, data=dat, family = poisson(link = 'log'), contrasts = list(site = contr.sum) ) ``` ::: ## Deviation Coding Interpretation {.scrollable} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} coef(model3) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) site1 site2 1.05162350 -0.02200408 -0.53581033 ``` ::: ::: Intercept = grand mean of site-means (log-scale) $\beta_{1}$ = effect difference of Site 1 from Grand Mean $\beta_{2}$ = effect difference of Site 2 from Grand Mean ::: {.fragment} #### The coefficient for site-level 3 (difference from the grand mean) ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} sum(coef(model3)[-1]*(-1)) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 0.5578144 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## Intuition Check {.scrollable} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} mean.group = aggregate(y, by=list(site=site),FUN=mean) mean.group ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` site x 1 Site 1 2.800 2 Site 2 1.675 3 Site 3 5.000 ``` ::: ::: ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Site 1 exp(1.05162350 + -0.02200408) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2.8 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} as.numeric(predict(model3,type="response")[1]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 2.8 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Site 2 exp(1.05162350 + -0.53581033) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1.675 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} as.numeric(predict(model3,type="response")[2]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 1.675 ``` ::: ::: ::: ::: {.fragment} ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} #Site 3 exp(1.05162350+0.5578144) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 5 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} as.numeric(predict(model3,type="response")[3]) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [1] 5 ``` ::: ::: ::: ## More Control Again! #### Contrasts No shared connection among these partial intercepts ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model4=glm(y~0+site, data=dat, family = poisson(link = 'log') ) # No shared intercept head(model.matrix(~0+site,data=dat),n=6) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` siteSite 1 siteSite 2 siteSite 3 1 1 0 0 2 0 1 0 3 0 0 1 4 1 0 0 5 0 1 0 6 0 0 1 ``` ::: ::: ## Same Model Different Estimates{.scrollable} #### Coeficients ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) siteSite 2 siteSite 3 Model1 1.0296194 -0.51380625 0.5798185 Model2 0.5158132 0.51380625 1.0936247 Model3 1.0516235 -0.02200408 -0.5358103 Model4 1.0296194 0.51581317 1.6094379 ``` ::: ::: #### Predictions ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` 1 2 3 4 5 Model1 1.029619 0.5158132 1.609438 1.029619 0.5158132 Model2 1.029619 0.5158132 1.609438 1.029619 0.5158132 Model3 1.029619 0.5158132 1.609438 1.029619 0.5158132 Model4 1.029619 0.5158132 1.609438 1.029619 0.5158132 ``` ::: ::: #### Deviance ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` [,1] Model1 137.6467 Model2 137.6467 Model3 137.6467 Model4 137.6467 ``` ::: ::: ## Taking Control ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} X = model.matrix(~Independent Variables) #all variables in dat (additive) X = model.matrix(~.,dat) #all variables in dat (pair-wise interactions) X = model.matrix(~.^2,dat) #all variables in dat (three way- interactions) X = model.matrix(~.^3,dat) model = glm(y~ 0 + X, ...) ``` ::: ## Poisson Regression (offset) What if our counts of pika are at plots with different sizes? Plot size ($\textbf{A}$) needs to be controlled for. But, we don't want to estimate an effect as it's part of the design. $$ \begin{align*} \textbf{y} \sim & \text{Poisson}(\frac{\boldsymbol{\lambda}}{\textbf{A}})\\ \text{log}(\frac{\boldsymbol{\lambda}}{\textbf{A}}) =& \textbf{X}\boldsymbol{\beta} \end{align*} $$ ## Offset ::: {.cell} ::: Equivalent $$ \begin{align*} \text{log}(\frac{\boldsymbol{\lambda}}{\textbf{A}}) =& \beta_0 + \beta_1 \textbf{x}_{1}\\ \text{log}(\boldsymbol{\lambda}) =& \beta_0 + \beta_1 \textbf{x}_{1} + 1\times \textbf{A} \end{align*} $$ ## Offset Code ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} model.rate1 = glm(y~site+offset(log(area)), data=dat, family = poisson(link = 'log') ) model.rate2 = glm(y~site, offset = log(area), data=dat, family = poisson(link = 'log') ) coef(model.rate1) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) siteSite 2 siteSite 3 -0.68867290 -0.09024110 0.04419089 ``` ::: ```{.r .cell-code} coef(model.rate2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` (Intercept) siteSite 2 siteSite 3 -0.68867290 -0.09024110 0.04419089 ``` ::: ::: ## ```{=html}




Variable Combinations
``` ## Additive #### Continuous and Categorical ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm(weight~sex+age.years,data=eleph) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-28-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: #### Continuous and Continuous ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm(weight~parastites+age.years,data=eleph) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-30-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Interaction #### Continuous and Categorical ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm(weight~sex*age.years,data=eleph) lm(weight~sex+age.years+sex:age.years,data=eleph) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-32-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: #### Continuous and Continuous ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm(weight~age.years*parastites,data=eleph) lm(weight~age.years+parastites+age.years:parastites,data=eleph) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-34-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Polynomial #### Quadratic ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm(weight~poly(age.years,2),data=eleph) lm(weight~age.years+I(age.years^2),data=eleph) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-36-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Transormations #### log ::: {.cell} ```{.r .cell-code} lm(weight~sex*I(log(age.years)),data=eleph) ``` ::: ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](glm2_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-38-1.png){width=960} ::: :::

include-after-body:
<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
